comments.inMonth: This node belongs to this month
comments.inFortnight: This node belongs to this fortnight
comments.inWeek: This node belongs to this ISO week
comments.inDay: This node belongs to this day
comments.inHalfDay: This node belongs to this half-day
comments.inShift: This node belongs to this shift
comments.ordinalIndex: Ordinal position of this node in its sequence (0-indexed)
comments.yearInDecade: Position of this year within its decade (0-9)
comments.monthInQuarter: Position of this month within its quarter (1-3)
comments.CategoricalTime: A recurring time category - not unique, many instances map to one category
comments.WeekParity: 2 categories: odd or even ISO week
comments.January: The first month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.February: The second month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.March: The third month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.April: The fourth month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.May: The fifth month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.June: The sixth month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.July: The seventh month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.August: The eighth month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.September: The ninth month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.October: The tenth month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.November: The eleventh month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.December: The twelfth month of any year. Recurs annually.
comments.Monday: The first day of the ISO week. Recurs weekly.
comments.Tuesday: The second day of the ISO week. Recurs weekly.
comments.Wednesday: The third day of the ISO week. Recurs weekly.
comments.Thursday: The fourth day of the ISO week. Recurs weekly.
comments.Friday: The fifth day of the ISO week. Recurs weekly.
comments.Saturday: The sixth day of the ISO week. Recurs weekly.
comments.Sunday: The seventh day of the ISO week. Recurs weekly.
comments.DecadeYear0: The 0th year of any decade (e.g. 2020, 2030). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear1: The 1st year of any decade (e.g. 2021, 2031). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear2: The 2nd year of any decade (e.g. 2022, 2032). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear3: The 3rd year of any decade (e.g. 2023, 2033). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear4: The 4th year of any decade (e.g. 2024, 2034). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear5: The 5th year of any decade (e.g. 2025, 2035). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear6: The 6th year of any decade (e.g. 2026, 2036). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear7: The 7th year of any decade (e.g. 2027, 2037). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear8: The 8th year of any decade (e.g. 2028, 2038). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.DecadeYear9: The 9th year of any decade (e.g. 2029, 2039). Recurs every 10 years.
comments.OddWeek: An odd-numbered ISO week. Recurs biweekly.
comments.EvenWeek: An even-numbered ISO week. Recurs biweekly.
comments.Weekday: Monday through Friday. The standard work week.
comments.Weekend: Saturday and Sunday. The standard rest days.
comments.MonthHas31Days: January, March, May, July, August, October, December.
comments.NewMoon: Moon not visible. Start of lunar cycle.
comments.WaxingGibbous: More than half illuminated, growing toward full.
comments.WaningGibbous: More than half illuminated, shrinking after full.
comments.AM: Ante meridiem: midnight to noon. Recurs daily.
comments.PM: Post meridiem: noon to midnight. Recurs daily.
comments.isDayOfWeek: This unique day falls on this recurring weekday
comments.isMonthOfYear: This unique month maps to this recurring month name
comments.isQuarterOfYear: This unique month falls in this recurring quarter
comments.isSeason: This unique month falls in this meteorological season
comments.isDecadePosition: This year's position within its decade
comments.isWeekParity: This week is odd or even numbered
comments.isDayType: This day is a weekday or weekend
comments.isMonthLength: How many days this unique month has
comments.isLunarPhase: The lunar phase on this day (computed from synodic cycle)
comments.isShiftName: This shift maps to this recurring shift name
comments.isHalfDayName: This half-day is AM or PM

files.purpose: Universal lifecycle phases — birth through death

comments.Growth: The entity is developing, accumulating capacity.
comments.Maturity: The entity is at peak function.
comments.Decay: The entity is declining in capacity.
comments.Death: The entity ceases to function or exist.
comments.isHistoricalTeacher: A dead entity whose signal history is still valuable for informing decisions about living entities. The dead teach the living.
comments.expectedLifecycleDuration: The typical total lifespan of entities in this collection. Domain-specific. Set by the domain seed, not the boot image.

files.purpose: Temporal unit hierarchy — epoch down to millisecond

comments.Era: 256 years. 8 per epoch. A civilizational unit.
comments.TemporalCoordinate: A fully-qualified position on the temporal spine. Example: Epoch-0 / Era-7 / Century-20 / Decade-2 / Year-2026 / Month-2 / Day-11 / Hour-14 / Minute-30 / Second-0 / Millisecond-0
comments.TemporalSlice: A CT scan of space at a moment in time. Every temporal coordinate has a corresponding spatial slice that captures the full state of all entities and their positions at that instant.
